heroDescription: Salem, Massachusetts, known for its rich history and vibrant culture, is a small city with a growing economy.
landscapeDescription: Salem's economy is diverse, with a focus on tourism, education, and healthcare. The city benefits from its proximity to Boston, enhancing its economic opportunities.
uniqueNeeds: Salem requires a focus on sustainable tourism and housing affordability to support its growing population.
citySpecificRiskAdvice: Salem's tourism reliance poses economic risks; housing market pressures may lead to affordability issues. Prepare for coastal flooding and diversify local industries.

sections.title: Economic Growth
sections.description: According to BEA (2023), Salem's economy has seen a 3% growth rate, driven by tourism and healthcare sectors.

sections.title: Wealth Demographics

sections.title: Cost of Living

sections.title: Real Estate Market

sections.title: Business Environment
sections.description: According to Fortune (2024), Salem's business climate is favorable, with incentives for small businesses and startups.
